sample: it is obscene it is obscene it is obscene. in 1992 the canadian supreme court ruled that it was more important to ban speech that is dehumanizing to women than to protect free speech. now we see the direct and indirect effects. we see the rise in murder in abuse in battles teen prostitution and teen suicide. we hear the wailing mothers the grieving sisters the tormented brothers and fathers and children planning their own funeral with pink dresses and pink caskets. if the filth that is portrayed in these gangsta rap videos and art is not obscene then i submit that nothing is obscene.

for 400 years profit came before principle. we marched for our rights to selma i was there with dr. king. —music that glorifies and promotes violence with guns knives or drugs— —and that includes all this gangsta rap— —thats it— —we march again and were gonna keep on marching and demonstrating till it...

—were beaten with billy clubs and were bitten with dogs unleashed by bull carters. we will not tolerate injustice and insults from our worst enemies then and we sure aint gonna accept insults from our youth...
